publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5087 Jeremy Purvis: Deacon Blue Live at HM Prison Kilmarnockâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the performance of Deacon Blue at HM Prison Kilmarnock on 3 November 2006; believes that music can play a role in assisting in the rehabilitation of offenders and a way of building self-confidence and creating self-respect; notes that while prison is about punishment it is also about rehabilitation and that improving arts and music training in our prisons is to be encouraged; congratulates the Irene Taylor Trust "Music in Prisons" project being rolled out in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, which runs creative music projects as part of educating and rehabilitating offenders, and urges that similar projects be introduced in Scotland.
S2M-5087 Deacon Blue Live at HM Prison Kilmarnock (lodged on 3 November 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-5087 Deacon Blue Live at HM Prison Kilmarnock (lodged on 3 November 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
